00001 // z_dsp.h -- the main header file for all DSP objects copyright 1997-2003 Cycling '74

00003 // DSP services:
00004 
00005 #ifndef _Z_DSP_H
00006 #define _Z_DSP_H

00008 #ifndef SAMPLE_TYPEDEF
00009 /** An integer. @ingroup msp    */
00010 typedef int t_int;
00011 /** A float.    @ingroup msp    */
00012 typedef float t_float;
00013 /** A sample value. @ingroup msp    */
00014 typedef float t_sample;
00015 #define SAMPLE_TYPEDEF
00016 #endif

00026 /** MSP System Properties.
00027     @ingroup     msp    */
00028 enum {
00029     SYS_MAXBLKSIZE = 2048,  ///< a good number for a maximum signal vector size
00030     SYS_MAXSIGS = 250       ///< number of signal inlets you can have in an object
00031 };
00032 
00033 // macro loop for checking for NAN/INF
00034 
00035 // note: this may be platform-dependent
00036 
00037 #define NAN_MASK 0x7F800000
00038 
00039 #define NAN_CHECK(n,o) \
00040 while (n--) { if ((*(o) & NAN_MASK) == NAN_MASK) *(o) = 0; (o)++; } // now post inc/dec -Rd jun 05
00041 
00042 #define IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)      ((((*(unsigned long *)&(v))&0x7f800000)==0)&&((v)!=0.f))
00043 #define IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)     ((((((unsigned long *)&(v))[1])&0x7fe00000)==0)&&((v)!=0.))         
00044 
00045 #define IS_NAN_FLOAT(v)         (((*(unsigned long *)&(v))&0x7f800000)==0x7f800000)
00046 #define IS_NAN_DOUBLE(v)        (((((unsigned long *)&(v))[1])&0x7fe00000)==0x7fe00000) 
00047 
00048 #define IS_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)      (IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)||IS_NAN_FLOAT(v))
00049 #define IS_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)     (IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)||IS_NAN_DOUBLE(v))         
00050 
00051 // currently all little endian processors are x86
00052 #if defined(WIN_VERSION) || (defined(MAC_VERSION)&&TARGET_RT_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
00053 #define DENORM_WANT_FIX     1
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 #ifdef DENORM_WANT_FIX
00057 
00058 #define FIX_DENORM_FLOAT(v)     ((v)=IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)?0.f:(v))
00059 #define FIX_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)    ((v)=IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)?0.f:(v))
00060 
00061 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)     ((v)=IS_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)?0.f:(v))
00062 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)    ((v)=IS_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)?0.:(v))
00063 
00064 #else
00065 
00066 #define FIX_DENORM_FLOAT(v)     
00067 #define FIX_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)    
00068 
00069 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)     
00070 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)
00071 
00072 #endif
00073 
00074 
00075 // header for all DSP objects. Provides a proxy.
00076 
00077 // z_misc flags:
00078 
00079 #define Z_NO_INPLACE 1  ///< flag indicating the object doesn't want signals in place @ingroup msp
00080 #define Z_PUT_LAST 2    ///< when list of ugens is resorted, put this object at end @ingroup msp
00081 #define Z_PUT_FIRST 4   ///< when list of ugens is resorted, put this object at beginning @ingroup msp
00082 
00083 typedef void *t_proxy;
00084 
00085 /** Header for any signal processing object. 
00086     @ingroup    msp */
00087 typedef struct t_pxobject {
00088     struct object z_ob; ///< The standard #t_object struct.
00089     long z_in;
00090 #ifdef PROBE_TEST
00091     void *z_proxy;
00092 #else
00093     t_proxy *z_proxy;
00094 #endif
00095     long z_disabled;    ///< set to non-zero if this object is muted (using the pcontrol or mute~ objects)
00096     short z_count;      ///< an array that indicates what inlets/outlets are connected with signals
00097     short z_misc;       ///< flags (bitmask) determining object behaviour, such as #Z_NO_INPLACE, #Z_PUT_FIRST, or #Z_PUT_LAST
00098 } t_pxobject;
00099 
00100 
00101 #define MAXLOGSIG 13
00102 #define MAXSIGSIZE (1 << MAXLOGSIG)
00103 /** The signal data structure.
00104     @ingroup    msp */
00105 typedef struct _signal
00106 {
00107     long s_n;                       ///< The vector size of the signal.
00108     t_sample *s_vec;                ///< An array of buffers holding the vectors of audio.
00109     float s_sr;                     ///< The sample rate of the signal.
00110     struct _signal *s_next;
00111     struct _signal *s_nextused;
00112     short s_refcount;
00113     short s_size;                   // element size (* s_n == memory)
00114     char *s_ptr;                    // what to free
00115 } t_signal;
00116 
00117 
00118 // c74 private
00119 
00120 typedef struct _dspchain
00121 {
00122     t_object c_ob;
00123     t_int *c_chain;
00124     long c_chainsize;
00125     long c_callcount;
00126     long c_usedcount;
00127     long c_reusedcount;
00128     long c_freedcount;
00129     long c_sr;
00130     long c_bs;
00131     t_signal *c_usedlist;
00132     t_signal *c_freelist;
00133     t_signal *c_zero;
00134     struct _ugenbox *c_ugenlist;    // temporary variable, allows reentrant compiling
00135     struct _dspchain *c_prev;
00136     void *c_patcher;    // top-level parent or 0 if global
00137     void *c_inlets;     // collection of inlets
00138     void *c_outlets;    // collection of outlets
00139     void *c_inputs;     // signal input list (zero before first exec)
00140     void *c_outputs;    // signal output list
00141     // have to determine whether freelist is global or local
00142     long c_broken;      // object being freed, don't run it
00143     long c_intype;      // using old signal linklist (0) or array
00144     long c_outtype;     // using old signal linklist (0) or array
00145 } t_dspchain;
00146 
00147 /** A function pointer for the audio perform routine used by MSP objects to process blocks of samples. @ingroup msp */
00148 typedef t_int *(*t_perfroutine)(t_int *args);
00149

00152 /** A void pointer.     @ingroup msp    */
00153 typedef void *t_vptr;
00154 /** A void pointer.     @ingroup msp    */
00155 typedef void *vptr;
00156 #define VPTR_TYPEDEF
00157 #endif

00161 #ifndef PI
00162 /** The pi constant.                @ingroup msp    */
00163 #define PI 3.14159265358979323846
00164 #endif
00165 #ifndef TWOPI
00166 /** Twice the pi constant.          @ingroup msp    */
00167 #define TWOPI       6.28318530717958647692
00168 #endif  // TWOPI
00169 #ifndef PIOVERTWO
00170 /** Half of the pi constant.        @ingroup msp    */
00171 #define PIOVERTWO   1.57079632679489661923
00172 #endif  // PIOVERTWO

00182 // access to DSP system variables
00183 
00184 /** Query MSP for the maximum global vector (block) size.
00185     @ingroup    msp 
00186     @return     The maximum global vector size for the MSP environment.     */
00187 int sys_getmaxblksize(void);
00188 
00189 /** Query MSP for the current global vector (block) size.
00190     @ingroup    msp 
00191     @return     The current global vector size for the MSP environment.     */
00192 int sys_getblksize(void);
00193 
00194 /** Query MSP for the global sample rate.
00195     @ingroup    msp 
00196     @return     The global sample rate of the MSP environment.      */
00197 float sys_getsr(void);
00198 
00199 int sys_getch(void);            // returns current number of channels
00200 int sys_optimize(void);         // returns whether to optimize or not
00201 int sys_altivec(void);          // returns whether machine has vector processing
00202 
00203 /** Query MSP to determine whether or not it is running.
00204     @ingroup    msp 
00205     @return     Returns true if the DSP is turned on, otherwise returns false.      */
00206 int sys_getdspstate(void);      // returns whether audio is on or off

00231 
00232 // setup routines used by DSP objects
00233 
00234 /** Call this function in your MSP object's dsp method.
00235     This function adds your object's perform method to the DSP call chain 
00236     and specifies the arguments it will be passed. 
00237     argc, the number of 
00238     arguments to your perform method, should be followed by argc 
00239     additional arguments, all of which must be the size of a pointer or a long.
00240     
00241     @ingroup    msp
00242     @param  f   The perform routine to use for processing audio.
00243     @param  n   The number of arguments that will follow
00244     @param  ... The arguments that will be passed to the perform routine.   */
00245 void dsp_add(t_perfroutine f, int n, ...);
00246 
00247 /** Call this function in your MSP object's dsp method.
00248     Use dsp_addv() to add your object's perform routine to the DSP call 
00249     chain and specify its arguments in an array rather than as arguments to 
00250     a function. 
00251         
00252     @ingroup        msp
00253     @param  f       The perform routine to use for processing audio.
00254     @param  n       The number of arguments that will follow in the vector parameter.
00255     @param  vector  The arguments that will be passed to the perform routine.   */
00256 void dsp_addv(t_perfroutine f, int n, void **vector);
00257 
00258 
00259 /** Call this routine after creating your object in the new instance routine 
00260     with object_alloc(). Cast your object to #t_pxobject as the first 
00261     argument, then specify the number of signal inputs your object will 
00262     have. dsp_setup() initializes fields of the #t_pxobject header and 
00263     allocates any proxies needed (if num_signal_inputs is greater than 1).
00264     
00265     Some signal objects have no inputs; you should pass 0 for 
00266     num_signal_inputs in this case. After calling dsp_setup(), you can 
00267     create additional non-signal inlets using intin(), floatin(), or 
00268     inlet_new().
00269 
00270     @ingroup            msp
00271     @param  x           Your object's pointer.
00272     @param  nsignals    The number of signal/proxy inlets to create for the object.
00273     @see                #dsp_setup  */
00274 void z_dsp_setup(t_pxobject *x, long nsignals);     // called in new method
00275 
00276 /** This is commonly used rather than directly calling z_dsp_setup() in MSP objects.
00277     @ingroup    msp */
00278 #define dsp_setup z_dsp_setup
00279 
00280 
00281 /** This function disposes of any memory used by proxies allocated by 
00282     dsp_setup(). It also notifies the signal compiler that the DSP call chain 
00283     needs to be rebuilt if signal processing is active. You should be sure to 
00284     call this before de-allocating any memory that might be in use by your 
00285     objectâ€™s perform routine, in the event that signal processing is on when 
00286     your object is freed.
00287 
00288     @ingroup    msp
00289     @param  x   The object to free.
00290     @see        #dsp_free   */
00291 void z_dsp_free(t_pxobject *x);
00292 
00293 /** This is commonly used rather than directly calling z_dsp_free() in MSP objects.
00294     @ingroup    msp */
00295 #define dsp_free z_dsp_free
00296

00339 #define PROXY_GETINLET(x) proxy_getinlet(x)

00341 
00342 /** This routine must be called in your object's initialization routine. It 
00343     adds a set of methods to your object's class that are called by MSP to 
00344     build the DSP call chain. These methods function entirely 
00345     transparently to your object so you don't have to worry about them. 
00346     However, you should avoid binding anything to their names: signal, 
00347     drawline, userconnect, and enable. 
00348     
00349     This routine is for normal (non-user-interface objects).
00350 
00351     @ingroup    msp
00352     @param  c   The class to make dsp-ready.
00353     @see        class_dspinitbox()  */
00354 void class_dspinit(t_class *c);
00355 
00356 /** This routine must be called in your object's initialization routine. It 
00357     adds a set of methods to your object's class that are called by MSP to 
00358     build the DSP call chain. These methods function entirely 
00359     transparently to your object so you don't have to worry about them. 
00360     However, you should avoid binding anything to their names: signal, 
00361     drawline, userconnect, and enable. 
00362     
00363     This routine is for normal user-interface objects.
00364 
00365     @ingroup    msp
00366     @param  c   The class to make dsp-ready.
00367     @see        class_dspinit() */
00368 void class_dspinitbox(t_class *c);
00369 
00370 
00371 // defines for SIMD optimization
00372 
00373 // minimum vector size to use SIMD optimization
00374 #define DSP_OPTIMIZE_MIN    64
00375 
00376 // simple (e.g. times, minus) not worth optimizing, disabled
00377 #define DSP_SIMPLE_OPTIMIZE_TEST(sigptr)        (FALSE)
00378 
00379 // simple parameter setting test (e.g. times, minus) not worth optimizing, disabled
00380 #define DSP_SIMPLE_OPTIMIZE_TEST_PARAM          (FALSE)
00381 
00382 // complex (e.g. cos, log, sqrt, fft family) optimize as long as enabled and vector is large enough
00383 #define DSP_COMPLEX_OPTIMIZE_TEST(sigptr)       (FALSE)
00384 //#define DSP_COMPLEX_OPTIMIZE_TEST(sigptr)     (sys_optimize()&&(sigptr)&&(sigptr)->s_n>=DSP_OPTIMIZE_MIN)
00385 
00386 // buffered routines optimize always if enabled since signal vector isn't relevant
00387 #define DSP_BUFFERED_OPTIMIZE_TEST(sigptr)      (FALSE)
00388 //#define DSP_BUFFERED_OPTIMIZE_TEST(sigptr)    (sys_optimize())
00389

00404 typedef struct _pxjbox {
00405     t_jbox z_box;
00406     long z_in;
00407 #ifdef PROBE_TEST
00408     void *z_proxy;
00409 #else
00410     t_proxy *z_proxy;
00411 #endif
00412     long z_disabled;
00413     short z_count;
00414     short z_misc;
00415 } t_pxjbox;
